intro: Guioa waigeoensis, commonly known as the Waigeo guioa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the island of Waigeo in the Indonesia province of West Papua. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a spherical capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
